learning_outcomes.description: Understand how microeconomic concepts can be applied to health and health care.
Identify appropriate economic theory related to health and health care across the lifespan.
Apply economic theory to analyse health and health care decisions.
Critically evaluate health and health care decisions using economic theory.
Communicate analyses of health and health care in non-technical, plain language, to interdisciplinary audiences.

assessments.due_date:
Due on Monday 2pm in the week after each tutorial. The Quiz will be open from the previous Thursday at 2pm.

There is no quiz during mid-semester break, week 10.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment will be weekly throughout the semester, each week, after the lecture and tutorial, there will be online MCQ questions. Extensions are not feasible. There will be 10 online quizzes, one a week, over 10 weeks. Each correct answer will receive 2 marks. The final % will be weighted to 20% of the overall course marks.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: There is no late submission allowed for quizzes. The quiz will close at 2pm on the Monday (except on October 6th, public holiday when the quiz will remain open until the day after, Tuesday 2 p.m.).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: There is no late submission allowed for quizzes. The quiz will close at 2pm on the Monday (except on October 6th, public holiday when the quiz will remain open until the day after, Tuesday 2 p.m.).
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Report: 2500 words report on topics from Lectures 2-6
assessments.task_description:
The assignment and precise topics will be discussed during tutorials at Week 6, and provided thereafter on Blackboard.

A detailed marking rubric will be provided on Blackboard.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignment must be submitted via Turnitin on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
28/07/2025 - 20/10/2025

This task will be based on teams, who must be present on the day of their presentation to achieve the overall team score.

The due date is the date is the tutorial time, which is assigned to the student, through the sign-up sheet, on Blackboard.

The assignment presentations will begin in week 2 and continue to week 12.
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Practical/ Demonstration, Presentation
assessments.task_description:
This task will be based on teams, discussing in person. It will involve a pre-arranged oral presentation to the class, based on the lecture topics. Topics will be assigned in the tutorial, and students will be assigned to teams. The task will involve reflection on learning of the topic, along with providing real-world examples for class discussion.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Slides must be prepared for the presentation. Instructions will be provided in tutorial 1. Each team member must be present on the day, or they will receive 0 marks for the assignment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 1

Why Health Economics? This lecture will introduce the students to the discipline and show how applied health economics fits into a broader area of health economics more generally.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
